name: Set-Azure-AD-Application
description: Set all the properties of an Azure AD Application
author: Ralph Jansen

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running PowerShell.

inputs.name: createIfNotExist
inputs.label: Create if not exist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create the Azure AD Application if the application doesn't exist. The check will be done on the name of the application.

inputs.name: objectId
inputs.label: Object Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Application object Id of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: appIdUri
inputs.label: App Id Uri
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the App Id Uri of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: homePageUrl
inputs.label: Home page URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Home page URL of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: logoutUrl
inputs.label: Logout URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Logout URL of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: termsOfServiceUrl
inputs.label: TermsOfServiceUrl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Terms of service URL of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: privacyStatementUrl
inputs.label: PrivacyStatementUrl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Privacy statement URL of the Azure AD Application.

inputs.name: multiTenant
inputs.label: Multi-tenant
inputs.helpMarkDown: Designates whether users in externa; organisations are allowed to grant your app access to data in their organization's directory.

inputs.name: replyUrlsMethod
inputs.label: Reply URLs Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the method to supply the reply urls.

inputs.name: replyUrlsSingleLine
inputs.label: Reply URLs
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of reply urls separated by ';' character.

inputs.name: replyUrlsMultiLine
inputs.label: Reply URLs
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of reply urls.

inputs.name: resourceAccessFilePath
inputs.label: Required Resource Access
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Json file with array of Required resource Access. The format should be the same as in the manifest.

So in example:
[ { "resourceAppId": "00000002-0000-0000-c000-000000000000", "resourceAccess": [ { "id": "5778995a-e1bf-45b8-affa-663a9f3f4d04", "type": "Role" }, { "id": "cba73afc-7f69-4d86-8450-4978e04ecd1a", "type": "Scope" } ] }, { "resourceAppId": "00000003-0000-0000-c000-000000000000", "resourceAccess": [ { "id": "7b2449af-6ccd-4f4d-9f78-e550c193f0d1", "type": "Role" } ] } ]

inputs.name: appRolesFilePath
inputs.label: AppRoles
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Json file with array of AppRoles. The format should be the same as in the manifest.

So in example:
[ { "allowedMemberTypes": [ "Application" ], "description": "Ability to delete all users", "displayName": "Delete All Users", "id": "829efba8-0659-40be-8a4a-cb338271ef9d", "isEnabled": true, "lang": null, "origin": "Application", "value": "Users.Delete.All" } ]

inputs.name: ownersMethod
inputs.label: Owners Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the method to supply the owners.

inputs.name: ownersSingleLine
inputs.label: Owners
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add a list of owners (list of ObjectIds or Service Principal Names (username) of AD Users) to an existing application. The connection service principal will always be added to the list of owners. The input must be a list of owners separated by ';' character.

inputs.name: ownersMultiLine
inputs.label: Owners
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add a list of owners (list of ObjectIds or Service Principal Names (username) of AD Users) to an existing application. The connection service principal will always be added to the list of owners. Put every owner on a new line.

inputs.name: secrets
inputs.label: Secrets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add a json array of secrets to be created (existing secrets with matching descriptions will be replaced) using the following format: [{ 'Description': 'MyDescription', 'EndDate': 'dd/MM/yyyy' }]. Existing secrets with description not used here will be skipped.

inputs.name: oauth2AllowImplicitFlow
inputs.label: Allow Implicit Flow
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether this web application can request OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens. The default is false.

inputs.name: appRoleAssignmentRequired
inputs.label: Application role assignment required
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an application role assignment is required.

outputVariables.name: ObjectId
outputVariables.description: The ObjectId of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: ApplicationId
outputVariables.description: The ApplicationId of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: Name
outputVariables.description: The Name of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: AppIdUri
outputVariables.description: The App Id Uri of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: HomePageUrl
outputVariables.description: The Home page URL of the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: ServicePrincipalObjectId
outputVariables.description: The ObjectId of the Service Principal connected to the Azure AD Application

outputVariables.name: Secret.MyDescription
outputVariables.description: The secret generated for the Azure AD Application. If multiple secrets are requested, an output variable for each secret will be available (convention: Secret.[Description] where [Description] is equal to the description provided in the 'Secrets' input field)
